titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in The Fairfax County Public Library
2015.166

archdesc.runner: Virginia Room, Fairfax County Public Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: The Wayne Hill Stereoview Collection, 1871-1909
did.abstract: The Wayne Hill Stereoview Collection consists of 71 stereoviews depicting scenes throughout Virginia including Fairfax County. The collection spans the years 1871-1909, although many are undated and some depict images from the Civil War era. Wayne Hill, a local photographer, collected and owned these stereoviews.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Room, Fairfax County Public Library. Wayne Hill Stereoview Collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated December 31, 2015 by Wayne Hill.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p:
Chris Barbuschak and David Turko, January 2016
EAD generated by Ross Landis, 2024

bioghist.head: Historical and Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Wayne Hill, a local photographer, collected stereoviews over a period of years. Born in Washington D.C., Hill attended Dartmouth College and graduated in 1966 with a B.A. in Environmental Psychology. After working with noted photographic artist Ansel Adams in California, Hill started his own company in Virginia called The HILL Art Group. For fifty years, Hill’s company has focused on photographing American National Parks and other scenic locations around the globe. In addition to his many artistic accomplishments and awards, Hill is the former President and CEO of Leadership Fairfax, Inc. and a former Board Member of the Fairfax County Chamber of Commerce and Greater Reston Chamber of Commerce.
